revised_title: Investigation of Hydrolysis of Cane Sugar by d- and l-Camphor-3-Sulphonic Acid
tldr: The author investigates the hydrolysis of cane sugar using d- and l-camphor-3-sulphonic acids and finds no significant difference in their activity. The results confirm previous findings that methylic d- and l-tartrates are hydrolyzed with equal readiness, while ethereal salts from optically active isomers are hydrolyzed at different rates.
